greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Infinite sequence of positive integers such that a(n) = A000005(a(1) + a(2) + ... + a(n)) for all n >= 1.
comment: Falcao (2015) proved that such an infinite sequence exists. Numerical evidence suggests that it may be also unique (cf. A259934).
If there are infinitely many n with a(n) = a(n+1), then A175304 is infinite (see comment in A259934). - _Vladimir Shevelev_, Jul 21 2015
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..64800 (Based on Robert Israel's b-file for A259934.)
Falcao et al., Sequence and divisors, 2015. (in Russian)
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, Jul 09 2015
